RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Professor e pesquisador do Programa de Pуs-graduaзгo em Comunicaзгo (PPGCOM) e do Departamento de Comunicaзгo da Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (UFPE). Realizou pуs-doutoramento na Universidade Federal Fluminense (UFF); doutorado em Comunicaзгo e Cultura Contemporвneas pela Universidade Federal da Bahia (UFBA) e mestrado em Teoria da Literatura pela Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (UFPE). RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Professor and researcher at the Postgraduate Program in Communication (PPGCOM) and at the Department of Communication at the Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE). completed post-doctoral studies at the Fluminense Federal University (UFF); PhD in Contemporary Communication and Culture from the Federal University of Bahia (UFBA) and master's degree in Literature Theory from the Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE). Finalist for the Jabuti award with the book "Ninguйm й Perfeito e a Vida й Assim: A Mъsica Brega em Pernambuco" (2017), a work that serves as a basis for the recognition of brega music as a cultural expression in Pernambuco. Author of the books "Modes of Experiencing Pop Music in Cuba" (2021); "A Estйtica do Videoclipe" (2014) and "Videoclipe, O Elogio da Desarmonia" (2004) and numerous articles and essays on music and media interfaces; performance; audio-visual; pop culture; journalism and celebrity culture.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: A linha pesquisa os fenфmenos estйticos como marcas das produзхes culturais que se manifestam sobretudo atravйs da imagem e do som. Nesse sentido, a кnfase recai sobre a manifestaзгo das subjetividades e percepзхes dos elementos sensнveis que aqui denominamos estйticos, explorando seus repertуrios de anбlise crнtica e de memуria, de produзгo de sentidos histуricos e posicionamentos polнticos. A estйtica й aqui compreendida tanto em sua constituiзгo teуrico-filosуfica quanto em termos de prбticas e expressхes de grupos sociais, atravйs da reflexгo que indica peculiaridades culturais e especificidades histуricas de sua presenзa.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Projeto investiga um dos epicentros da problemбtica terminolуgica da Cultura Pop, a mъsica. Grande parte do que se entende por Cultura Pop advйm de relaзгo dos sujeitos com a mъsica pop, suas sonoridades, imagens, corpos e espaзos. Por isso, delineia-se como problema de pesquisa a investigaзгo de como se constrуem valores (FRITH, 1996; POWERS, 2004; SANJEK, 2005; DOUGHER, 2005) nos sistemas da Mъsica Pop e mais amplamente na Cultura Pop, tendo como epicentros investigativos:

1. as performances de artistas emblemбticos da mъsica pop; de fгs destes artistas articulados em comunidades (fandoms) e destas experiкncias performбticas enunciadas em espaзos codificados (como shows, eventos ou rituais midiбticos), seus sentidos e linguagens gerando experiкncias. Toma-se aqui a noзгo de performance na mъsica como a corporificaзгo de sonoridades em espaзos prй-definidos, espetбculos musicais midiatizados e em canзхes ou бlbuns fonogrбficos (FRITH, 1996; AUSLANDER, 2012), reconhecendo que a performance й a disposiзгo material a ser investigadas como princнpio orientador das lуgicas de gкneros musicais e da indъstria da mъsica. O interesse sobre a performance encaminha os estudos deste projeto para o debate em torno da dimensгo estйtica das experiкncias performбticas, suas formas de produзгo e reconhecimento a partir de premissas de ordens individuais ou coletivas. 

2. as territorialidades sфnico-expressivas; os ambientes de circulaзгo, fruiзгo e consumo de artistas da mъsica pop; as cidades que emolduram cenбrios e cenas musicais (STRAW, 2003; JANOTTI e SБ, 2013) e as experiкncias de passagens e espaзos que orientam nomadismos na cultura das festas e dos eventos, desenhando-se uma geografia de desejos (PARKER, 2002; THORNTON, 1995) e devires embalados por acordes musicais. Tem-se aqui a territorialidade (DENORA, 2000) como moldura teуrica capaz de pensar geopolнticas das sonoridades e das indъstrias da mъsica; culturas que se encenam em corpos musicais e ambientes banhados por mъsicas; sexualidades e performances de gкneros (BUTLER, 1993) em trвnsito entre canзхes, espaзos e afetos; estados emocionais que motivam deslocamentos numa cultura musical em contextos culturais. Pensa-se territorialidade numa interface com gкneros musicais (NEGUS, 1992, 1996, 1999), sobretudo reconhecendo endereзamentos genйricos como capazes de gerar estйticas que habitam lugares polнticos nas metrуpoles. A mъsica pop й uma articuladora de tessituras urbanas reais e ficcionais, a partir de vozes e corpos que se materializam entre redes de sociabilidades.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Mъsica Pop em Cuba: Enfrentamentos Polнticos e Midiбticos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Atravйs da presenзa de vestнgios da cultura pop anglуfila na ilha de Cuba, aciona-se pensar as contradiзхes em torno dos fruidores de mъsica pop em Havana, que, a despeito de toda tradiзгo revolucionбria do regime de governo cubano, ostentam нcones da cultura norte-americana em seu cotidiano. A hipуtese que norteia este projeto й a de que hб um geraзгo de jovens cubanos que negociam tanto com o histуrico de premissas revolucionбrias quanto com a cultura pop norte-americana problematizando definiзхes estanques em torno de dinвmicas identitбrias e performбticas. A maneira com que fгs cubanos de artistas como Madonna e Lady Gaga adquirem produtos de seus нdolos (nгo comercializados em ?tiendas?/lojas), a lуgica da pirataria como forma de contato com o ?exterior? e a maneira com que conectam os artistas a um certo imaginбrio de resistкncia, posiciona os fгs de mъsica pop em Cuba num singular lugar de reflexгo sobre a ampliaзгo do conceito de Naзгo.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Through the presence of anglophile pop culture traces on the island of Cuba, the contradictions around pop consumers in Havana are evoked. In despite of all revolutionary tradition of the Cuban government regime, young cuban citizens display US American culture icons in their everyday lives. The hypothesis that guides this project is that there is a generation of young cubans who deal with both: the history of revolutionary premises and with american pop culture questioning watertight definitions around identity and performative dynamics. The way cuban fans of artists like Madonna and Lady Gaga acquire products of their idols (not sold in "tiendas" / stores), the logic of piracy as a form of contact with the "outside" and the way that connect artists to a certain imaginary resistance, places the pop music fans in Cuba as a unique place of reflection on the expansion of the concept of nation.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Mъsica Pop Perifйrica na Amйrica Latina: Anбlise Comparativa dos Contextos Brasil e Argentina
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A pesquisa realizou um estudo comparativo dos gкneros musical mъsica brega (Brasil) e cumbia villera (Argentina) partindo da hipуtese de que a atividade musical exercida por sujeitos moradores das periferias de metrуpoles latino-americana reivindicam cidadanias bastardas e parciais (RINCУN, 2016) que operam sobre a lуgica da visibilidade, do estigma e das tensхes sociais. A investigaзгo avanзa no debate sobre as mъsicas pop perifйricas (SБ, 2017) e seus contextos midiбticos em rede atravйs de plataformas midiбticas reconhecendo a existкncia de prбticas, poйticas e sensibilidades que tanto se aproximam quanto se diferenciam entre Brasil e Argentina. A perspectiva esboзa quadros complexos sobre as relaзхes entre mнdia, mъsica pop e cidadania em contextos de alta visibilidade. Delimita-se dois contextos de investigaзгo: as cenas musicais das cidades de Recife, no Brasil (referente а mъsica brega) e de Buenos Aires, na Argentina (referente а cumbia villera). Trata-se de uma pesquisa de campo, de carбter exploratуrio, realizada nos dois contextos, a partir de ida a festas e entrevistas com DJs e artistas que apresentam dimensхes performбticas em videoclipes de emblemбticos artistas destas cenas musicais. Reconhecer analogias histуricas, estйticas e polнticas entre fenфmenos musicais no вmbito Brasil-Argentina significa conectar sensibilidades perifйricas do Sul global (SANTOS, 2010) propondo o entendimento de que prбticas musicais e midiбticas sгo sintomбticas na formaзгo de sensos identitбrios nacionais а margem da grande narrativa sobre Brasil e Argentina. Pensar a mъsica brega e a cumbia villera de forma conjunta e disruptiva significa reconhecer a disputa pela noзгo de identidade nacional que se forma nas margens de gкneros musicais hegemфnicos, nas suas condiзхes de classe, gкnero e raзa e manifestaзхes em experiкncias no campo da mъsica e da mнdia.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The research carried out a comparative study of the musical genres brega music (Brazil) and cumbia villera (Argentina) based on the hypothesis that the musical activity carried out by subjects living on the outskirts of Latin American metropolises claim bastard and partial citizenships (RINCУN, 2016) that they operate on the logic of visibility, stigma and social tensions. The investigation advances in the debate on peripheral pop music (SБ, 2017) and its networked media contexts through media platforms, recognizing the existence of practices, poetics and sensibilities that both approach and differ between Brazil and Argentina.The perspective sketches complex pictures about the relations between media, pop music and citizenship in high visibility contexts. Two research contexts are delimited: the musical scenes of the cities of Recife, Brazil (referring to brega music) and Buenos Aires, Argentina (referring to cumbia villera). This is an exploratory field research, carried out in both contexts, based on visits to parties and interviews with DJs and artists who present performance dimensions in video clips of emblematic artists from these music scenes. Recognizing historical, aesthetic and political analogies between musical phenomena in the Brazil-Argentina context means connecting peripheral sensibilities of the global South (SANTOS, 2010) proposing the understanding that musical and media practices are symptomatic in the formation of national identity senses on the margins of the great narrative. about Brazil and Argentina. Thinking about brega music and cumbia villera in a joint and disruptive way means recognizing the dispute over the notion of national identity that is formed on the margins of hegemonic musical genres, in their conditions of class, gender and race and manifestations in experiences in the field of music and music. from the media.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O mote do projeto й a discussгo de filmes que abordam questхes de gкnero e seus desdobramentos na Escola Pъblica Silva Jardim, na cidade do Recife. Durante as oficinas serгo executadas atividades, orientadas pelos oficineiros, que visam fomentar a prбtica audiovisual a partir dessa temбtica. A metodologia adotada й a cartilha de oficinas do projeto "Inventar com a Diferenзa", que levou o cinema para alunos de escolas pъblicas de todo Brasil. O pъblico alvo sгo adolescentes que fazem parte do nъcleo de estudo de gкnero WIlma Lessa da EREM Silva Jardim, ministrado pela professora Cristiana Cordeiro, sгo cerca de 20 alunos entre 15 e 18 anos. A aзгo usa a plataforma Google Meet em funзгo da pandemia. Os integrantes desse projeto sгo os arte educadores Joyce Carmo, graduanda de cinema (UFPE), Mayara Ferreira, graduanda da licenciatura em danзa (UFPE), Felipe Karnakis, graduando de Cinema ( UFPE).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Performance e Capital Especulativo na Cultura Pop: Protocolos Metodolуgicos para Estudo das Dramaturgias nos Roteiros Comunicacionais
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto debate a intensificaзгo de uma cultura de especulaзгo sobre artistas musicais nas redes sociais digitais como traзo fundamental do consumo da Cultura Pop. Aponta para a noзгo de capital especulativo como um ativo sobre o qual artistas se movem no mercado musical e do entretenimento a partir da agкncia de um regime performбtico autorreferente e codificado nas prбticas de fгs. Evidencia que videoclipes seriam territorialidades dramбticas em que performances audiovisuais em rede conectam estratйgias mercadolуgicas e de consumo cultural, apontando para rasuras ficcionais que colocam em cena dramaturgias na cultura pop. Postula-se que as metodologias de estudos de performance sгo fundamentais para enquadramentos analнticos e clivagens conceituais.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The project discusses the intensification of a culture of speculation about musical artists on digital social networks as a fundamental feature of Pop Culture consumption. It points to the notion of speculative capital as an asset on which artists move in the music and entertainment market from of the agency of a self-referential performative regime codified in fan practices. It shows that music videos would be dramatic territorialities in which networked audiovisual performances connect marketing strategies and cultural consumption, pointing to fictional erasures that put dramaturgies in pop culture on the scene. It is postulated that performance studies methodologies are fundamental for analytical frameworks and conceptual cleavages.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A Cosmйtica do Sangue: O Baixo Orзamento como Valor nos Filmes de Terror
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: The Cosmetic of Blood: The Low Budget as Value in Horror Movies

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The 2013 release of two low-budget horror remakes (Evil Dead and The Texas Chainsaw
Massacre) seems to confront us with an issue concerning to the construction of value in film genres. In this paper we present how the horror genre has built up the idea that these productions endorse an authenticity of fear. This text will discuss the readings of the two remakes trying to understand what we call here as ?cosmetic of blood?: the emulation of low-budget effects with high budgets.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Estйtica do Fandom: Experiкncia e performance na mъsica pop
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Fandom Aesthetics: Experience and performance in pop music

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We propose to discuss certain ?fandom aesthetics? in pop music through the idea of performance in ritual sites such as concerts, forums, online and offline groups. Issues anchored in identity, memory, imagination, legitimacy, contention, affection and physical engagement of the fan come to provide tools to question the existence of specificities which can argue in favor of a singular aesthetic in mediated experience of the mass popular music fandom. On their own belonging space, the media fandom seems dawn of pop music frivolities and exaggerations with a conceptual issue through an empirical overview: there is a particular aesthetic triggered by the body and virtual experience of pop music fans?

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Barba, brilho e make: a identidade viajante de Conchita Wurst no Eurovision 2014
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Beard, glitter and make: Conchita Wurst's traveler identity in 2014 Eurovision

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Conchita Wurst, winner of the 2014 edition of the Eurovision Song Contest, drew attention not only for her vocal quality, but also by the physical image that blends the feminine and masculine universes, such as dresses, makeup and beard, creating an unsettling figure. Based on the Queer Theory studies of Guacira Lopes and Judith Butler, the goal of this work is to analyse the singer's performance at the festival, also
using semiotic and cultural studies bases. The article aims to analyse not only the music(Rise Like a Fenix) played by Conchita Wurst, but also the pictorial and visible elements of the presentation, assuming that the representation(physical and mental) go beyond simple orality, and the gender identities aren?t simple and solid as the social norms imposes

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Acionamentos geopolнticos num show de mъsica pop em Cuba
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Geopolitical assemblages in a pop music concert in Cuba

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Facing a historical context of political and economic tension between Cuba and the United States, we investigate a pop music concert held in March 2016 in Anti-Imperialist Tribune, Havana, played by electronic music group Major Lazer, as a performance around the cultural memory in America, as postulated by Diana Taylor (2013). The staging of performance arrangements of musicians and the audience refers to rituals that reveal contradictions around the presence of American products traces in Cuban territory. We debate the erasures of restrictive communication policies by the Cuban government and the display of icons linked to United States by the Cuban youth as an inner question about a national project built in the Caribbean island.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Polнticas de gкnero nas performances de Madonna
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Gender policies in Madonna's performances

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: From the analysis of two live performances by the American singer Madonna, Papa don?t preach (1987) and Like a virgin (2012), we have identified an aestheticization of the artist?s body, which can place it at the heart of discussions concerning political topics related to youth and aging. Understanding pop as a rich field for debating issues that affect both the way we feel and inhabit the contemporary world, we have attempted here to think of how Madonna drives her own body as a discursive concept that constructs generational femininity matrices.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Sobre a tensгo entre Justin Bieber e seus fгs: Apontamentos para uma pedagogia das emoзхes
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: On the tension between Justin Bieber and his fans: Notes for a pedagogy of emotions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
From the tense relationship of singer Justin Bieber and his fans, along the Purpose Tour that went
through Brazil between March and April 2017, a set of questions are raised that point to: 1. the
attemption to build an artistic recognition for Bieber, whose trajectory is strongly marked by
questions about his musical gifts; 2. the strategy of building authenticity that goes through the
performatization of the "bad boy", widely spread in the universe of rap; 3. the dynamics of pedagogy
of the fans' emotion, around an ethics that points to the boundaries between bodies and subjects in
high visibility contexts.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: -What?s Going On й o Sgt. Pepper?s da soul music-: autonomia, cвnone e valor numa lista de maiores бlbuns da mъsica
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: ?WHAT'S GOING ON Й O SGT. PEPPER'S DA SOUL MUSIC?: AUTONOMIA, CВNONE E VALOR NUMA LISTA DE MAIORES БLBUNS DA MЪSICA

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: 'Madonna, Guerreira como Cuba'
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Madonna, Warrior Like Cuba

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Through the practices of the main fan of the US singer Madonna in Cuba, we investigate how cubans deal with the presence of Anglo-American icons of pop culture on the socialist island. A set of tensions about the presence of fan objects in the country is pointed out revealing a particular form of globalization that seems to negotiate the flows of transnational capital with the singularity of the Cuban state regime. From the memory of the fan, an itinerary takes us to the TV programColorama, a kind of "cuban MTV". It postulates that the cultural consumption of Madonna artifacts on the island can be perceived as a dynamic of resistance, negotiation and solidarity of communities of fans that connect also through the social network Facebook.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Reguetуn en Cuba: censura, ostentaciуn y grietas en las polнticas mediбticas
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Reggaeton in Cuba: Censorship, Ostentation and Cracks in Media Policies

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Building on the censorship of a videoclip in Cuban media systems, the controversies arising from the presence of reggaeton in Cuba are addressed in this paper. A musical genre that is strongly anchored in the Caribbean diasporas in the United States, reggaeton stages discussions on the construction
of a notion of transnational, youthful and cosmopolitan Pan-Latinity, marked by consumption and ostentation, which seems to question the uniqueness of Cuba as a socialist nation in Latin America. The problem around the performance of the ?successful man? who owns mansions and cars in a country whose economy is strongly mediated by the state emerges; conflicts with other Cuban musical genres are noted; and it is claimed that alternative unofficial forms of production and dissemination?which make global
identity actions explicit?undermine national policies on ?being Cuban.?

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: 'I wanted to eat you?: rock star fantasy in a children?s TV show

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: From the presence of a ?gaъcho rocker? on a children?s television program, we propose to discuss theoretical and methodological possibilities of the Performance Studies in the analysis of television products. The notions of screenplay and performance frame (Taylor, 2013) are subsidies to treat the encounter between the band Os Cascavelletes and the presenter Angelica in the Clube da Crianзa show in TV Manchete, as the performance towards the strangeness of the figure of the young, urban and gaъcho rocker, in Brazil?s media context of the 1980s. Carnivalization and fantasy integrate guiding principles of the theatricality of this meeting that was marked in the memory of members of the rock music scene of Porto Alegre

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Abordagens Teуricas para Estudo da Teatralidade em Performances Midiбticas
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Theoretical Approaches to Study Theatricality in Media Performances: Dramas, scripts, actions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article proposes to consider the concept of performance in the contemporary media context, as it is necessary to confront the problems of visibility at a time in which, in the face of constant activations of the body via photographs, selfies, and appearances on social networks, values emerge in the experiences that synthesize ways of living in a codified world. Media performances are bodily activations of individuals in media environments involving the development of a ?theatrical life? in high visibility contexts and the construction of networks of biographic meaning, e.g., the experienced and the reported, in quotidian dynamics. Media performances, insofar as they are projected for the Other, form speculative

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Paquetes Como Gambiarras Midiбticas: Transnacionalismo e Consumo Cultural no Contexto Havana-Miami
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Paquetes as Improvised Media: Transnationalism and Cultural Consumption in Havana-Miami Context

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Mediatic gambiarras are alternative and improvised forms of media consumption. They emerge in adverse or restrictive contexts. Signal the need for connection on the part of those who use them. In the island of Cuba, paquetes, sets of files containing pop culture content, music, series, US blockbusters, among others, not shown in Cuban media systems, are the most estab-lished cultural form of mediatic gambiarra on the socialist island. The article presents the result of a research project carried out between the years 2015 and 2017, based on an ethnographic-inspired methodology, with field interviews and participant observation in the city of Havana, with the purpose of debating different uses of the paquetes by consumers and fans of pop culture in the Cuban context. Contradictions about the practices of paqueteros ? subjects who sell paquetes in online and offline network creations ? are mapped from the emergence of traces of capitalism in Cuba that pass through the always conflicting relationship between residents in Havana and migrants in Miami in symbolic disputes on the island. The questions raised in the field signal for different matrixes around transnationalism in Latin America, geopolitical issues and point to understandings about the singularities and challenges of contemporary Cuba.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Juventudes, cosmopolitismos e consumo midiбtico
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Youths, cosmopolitanisms and media consumption: research experiments in Cuba

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article discusses the media consumption related to pop music among young Cubans based on ethnographic-inspired field research conducted between 2016 and 2017 in Havana, which problematizes the prescriptions of youth studies in Latin America. The relevance of the study lies in debating cosmopolitanism in particular economic and political contexts highlighting different ways of constructing ideals of Modernity. It presents a theoretical and conceptual discussion to assist studies and analysis about youths contrasting the tensions of digital and media consumption in the socialist island. Highlights the consecration of a particular format of media, the ?paquete digital? (?digital package? - set of downloaded and shared files) that focuses on the debate on Internet access in Cuba, political and ideological disputes regarding the economic embargo imposed on the country and attempts at dialogue of the Cuban state with youth.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Moral disputes in peripheral pop music:study from bregafunk

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Atividades ligadas ao patrimфnio cultural e ambiental

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The beats of bregafunk and the praises that announce an evangelical cult, on a street in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Recife, bring to the forefront a set of moral disputes (MISKOLCI, 2021) in peripheral pop songs (PEREIRA DE SБ, 2021) that pass through frameworks that link bodiesto performance conditions in their leisure dynamics. A methodology that articulates Performance Studies for the interpretation of musical phenomena anchored in the spatial cleavage and the formation of dramatic frames (SOARES, 2017) in the urban fabric maps performative erasures (TAYLOR, 2013), sound policies, body choreography and ground policies (LEPECKI, 2011) in which, in addition to discourse, sensitive spheres emerge that problematize moral frameworks.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Sensibilidades pop perifйricas
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Sensibilidades pop perifйricas: aproximaciones teуricas a los estudios sobre la mъsica pop de Amйrica Latina

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Atividades ligadas ao patrimфnio cultural e ambiental

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A partir de narraciones episуdicas, crнticas culturales a discos fonogrбficos y videoclips de tres artistas que, aunque cantan en espaсol y portuguйs, estбn consagrados en la cultura pop angloparlante, este artнculo argumenta la ruptura teуrica en torno a las nociones de entrelugar, colonialidad y bastardizaciуn como dispositivos conceptuales capaces de complejizar las lecturas de los fenуmenos de la mъsica pop atravesados por la idea de latinidad. Apuesta por la comprensiуn de que las sensibilidades pop perifйricas desplazan las interpretaciones a negociaciones estйticas y polнticas que ponen en sospecha tradiciones basadas en el marxismo en el anбlisis de producciones provenientes de las industrias del entretenimiento.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Sin rehuir en absoluto el pensamiento complejo y dejando muy claro cуmo nuestra orientaciуn sexual determina gran parte de lo que acontece en nuestras vidas, este texto discute de manera muy detallada sobre los procesos polнticos y culturales que, en el marco de la globalizaciуn, llevan a que culturas distintas puedan dialogar entre sн. El autor pretende, en primer lugar, entender por quй conectar con la mъsica pop procedente de Estados Unidos no se contradice en absoluto con los valores construidos por la Revoluciуn cubana y, en segundo, al terminar ese recorrido, descubrir eventos musicales protagonizados por grupos estadounidenses en La Habana que se convierten en un espacio privilegiado para el anбlisis. 
A modo de ejemplo, no es casual que la mъsica cubana estuviera presente en la cena que Raъl Castro organizу en el Palacio de la Revoluciуn para recibir a la familia Obama en su visita a la isla en marzo de 2016.
